title: MAXjet Typeface
content: What’s that typeface in the full-page MAXjet ad in to-day’s _New York Times_? (NYC Late Edition, ‘N’, p. A17). Does anyone here know?
author: Maxim Zhukov

comments.content: No _The New York Times_ here unfortunately. We’ll have to wait for the East Coasters to jump into action.

If you mean [MAXjet Airways](http://web.archive.org/web/20051219065743/https:/www.maxjet.com/) — they use [Clearface Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20051219065743/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=clearface+gothic&image.x=0&image.y=0) on their website. Dunno if this helps…
No, in the ad some kind of kinky Baroque Old-Style serif is used (remindful of Mrs. Eaves, somehow; I know the latter is neither an Old Style nor Baroque…). I am very intrigued.
